content.question: Which of the following is a Dorian scale?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the treble clef. Each score has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a set of eight quarter notes played in succession. The pitches in score A are: E4, F sharp 4, G4, A4, B4, C5, D5, and E5.

Score B has one staff in the treble clef. Each score has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a set of eight quarter notes played in succession. The pitches in score B are: E4, F sharp 4, G4, A4, B4, C sharp 5, D5, and E5.

Score D has one staff in the treble clef. Each score has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a set of eight quarter notes played in succession. The pitches in score D are: E4, F sharp 4, G sharp 4, A4, B4, C sharp 5, D sharp 5, and E5.

content.answer: Score B has one staff in the treble clef. Each score has no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a set of eight quarter notes played in succession. The pitches in score B are: E4, F sharp 4, G4, A4, B4, C sharp 5, D5, and E5.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
